bibl.title: F. Ota v. S. Takahasha, John Doe. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

body.p: IN THE UNTITED STATES DISTRICT COURT IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION
In the matter of the application of F, Ota for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
No. 3130. ORDER GRANTING WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS

Upon reading and filing the petition of S. Yoshida duly signed and verified by him, whereby it appears that F. Ota is illegally imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by one S. Takahasha and John Doe on a certain boat, now lying at the Great Northern Dock at Smith's Cove in the City of Seattle, State of Washington, County of King, and stating wherein the alleged illegality consists, from which it appears to me that a Writ of Habeas Corpus out to issue,

IT IS ORDERED that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and udner the seal of the United States District Court in and for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, directed to S. Takahasha and John Doe commanding them to have the body of the said F. Ota before me in the court room of said court, at Seattle, King County, Washington, on Wednesday the 27th day of October, 1915, at 10:00 A.M. of that day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said F. Ota, together with the time and cause of his detention and that you will have then and there said Writ.
Done in open court this 19th day of October, A.D. 1915.
